meanings.definition: Relating to or characteristic of a telomere.
meanings.sent1: The telomic region of the chromosome plays a crucial role in cell division.
meanings.sent2: Scientists study the telomic sequences to understand aging and cancer.
meanings.sent3: The telomic puzzle was finally solved by the research team.
meanings.sent4: Her telomic research shed light on the mysteries of cellular aging.
meanings.sent5: The telomic structure is like a protective cap for the chromosome.

meanings.definition: Of or relating to the end of a chromosome.
meanings.sent1: At the telomic end of the chromosome, important genetic information is stored.
meanings.sent2: The telomic region is crucial for maintaining chromosome stability.
meanings.sent3: The telomic tip of the chromosome seemed to wave goodbye under the microscope.
meanings.sent4: The telomic edge of the chromosome is where the magic of genetics happens.
meanings.sent5: The telomic boundary marks the final frontier of the chromosome.

meanings.definition: Pertaining to the structure or function of telomeres.
meanings.sent1: The telomic changes in the telomeres can affect cell aging.
meanings.sent2: Telomic research focuses on understanding the role of telomeres in health.
meanings.sent3: The telomic dance of the telomeres was a sight to behold.
meanings.sent4: Her telomic investigation revealed the secrets of telomere lengthening.
meanings.sent5: The telomic integrity of telomeres is crucial for cellular health.
